I've been to Mini Bar a few times since it's opened and though it's small I never felt claustrophobic. The bartenders are nice, the place is clean and the drinks are strong. I went this past Friday night with a group of people. We grabbed a table and never had a problem getting a drink. 

Thank you Mini Bar, for letting me get trashed and stumble home the full block and a half to my house.
author: Corey V.

description: Mini bar is a great neighborhood bar. Cool crowd. Dogs abound. And they serve booze, not just beer and wine like most other places in the neighborhood. Les is one of the best bartenders in SF. Just like Jon, Molly, Scott, James, Star, and Summer. And though I read a review about someone complaining about getting guff for ordering a bloody on a Sunday evening, go home and make it yourself... ordering a bloody in a busy bar after 5 is an amateur move (especially if the bartender lets you know after a few rounds, it's a hard f*cking job). Appreciate your bartenders! Go back to the marina, and better yet, stay there...
author: Jason G.

description: Any bar that serves shots in a low ball, w/ a beer back gets 5 stars from me. Always drop in on my way to the lady's place. All of the staff, past and present, have been awesome. Love hanging on divis, Mini makes it that much better!
author: I D.

description:
I went there for the first time last Friday night.  Pretty great experience considering I rarely venture out on weekend nights to weekend places.

The crowd is not anything overly specific.  They're a dressed up version of 821, friendly, mid 20s to 40s, locals.  Well behaved, just lookin to relax.

Love the art.  Love supporting local artists.

We were lucky enough to get a spot in the back room.  We were four, and shared the room with two other groups.  Everyone played nice, and shared the space well.  Of course, around midnight, the two other groups had gone, and a loud group of douchebags replaced them.  We left when we realized they were there to stay.  But that's not the bar's fault.

The staff were extremely friendly, which is not always the case in this neighborhood.  We get a lot of ARTISTE types working the service jobs.  I generally do not appreciate the ARTISTE types.  Unless they're friendly ARTISTEs.  That's cool with me.

The location is great, as I live about 6 blocks away.

Overall, I could not have been happier. The music was good, yet ignorable.  The size was perfect for not feeling like a sardine in a massive tin.  

Oh yeah, my last kudo is for the bathroom.  They had recycling for paper towels (sweet), and it was so nicely decorated and well kept.  So civil.  THAT bumps them up to 5 stars.
author: Meredith M.

description:
This is a great little bar in NoPa. I think it's the perfect place to meet a friend to chill, hang and qvetch!

Love it. Two thumbs up.
author: Al B.

description:
Mini Bar is very nice and welcoming, aesthetically as well as owner and staff-wise.  I hope that they'll be able to get permission to stay open until 2am in the near future (opening a bar in san francisco at all can be a herculean feat, and the owners apparently went through a lot just to get the doors open).

edit: I guess they're open until 2:00 now?
author: Mynameisdavid M.

description: Love this place. It's a pretty chill little bar, at least when I come, but it can get busy.  Because of my schedule, I come mostly on Saturday afternoons and usually a bartender named Annie is there. She makes an awesome martini (dangerously good really), is super friendly and quick with the drinks, even when it's busy. Love an efficient bartender and she obviously knows what the hell she is doing. The art they feature is great and the dogs are fun too - as are the regulars.
author: Natalie T.

description:
Minibar is an awesome space that truly is mini! Sommer, the owner, did an amazing job with the design. The artwork that is displayed is awesome and THERE'S A FULL BAR!!!!! There's only a couple places in Nopa that have a full bar so this is a very exciting thing. 

The staff is nice and the prices are good. The little private room in the back is  perfect for a group of 6-8 people.
author: Kandace K.

description: Okay Russian River Brewery has a couple good beers.  There IPA is awesome and you can't mess with Pliny.  I would still like to see Mach 10 from Bear Republic though.
author: Scott B.

description:
Met up with friends to celebrate a birthday here last night.  Great atmosphere, cool art on the walls, and a kicking Monday drink special-$3 for a 16oz bottle of tasty German lager.  When the 16oz bottles ran out, the bartender gave us 12 oz bottles for $2, which, after we did the math, turned out to be an even better deal!  

Speaking of the bartenders, it was the second time I'd been to Mini Bar, and both times I was utterly charmed by the staff.  They like, talk to you like you're a real person and stuff, like you've been their friend all along and only just discovered it for yourself upon wandering into their bar.  

Nice bartenders, WTF?  Oh, wait, I'm not in the Mission!  THAT explains it!
author: Kevin H.

description:
I went for the first time to check out the Noise Pop Retrospective Art opening to get my art on.  Instead I got my art broke then had an art attack.  And it was GREAT!

No seriously...this place is my new favorite art gallery with a full bar!   It's cute, friendly staff, good happy hour prices, drinkable wine.  Recommended for those having art openings plus it's right across the street from Little Star and they have a binder of menus from neighborhood restaurants so you can bring stuff in.  

Good good!
author: annie s.

description: With $2 draft beers a plenty, it can be a mini-feat to find a Jack and Diet or a Vodka soda.  Minibar can give me what I want since it is one of the few establishments on Divisadero with hard alcohol.
author: jane d.

description:
Right across the street from Little Starr. Can't beat that.

The place is small, but carries a neighborhood charm. Great place to meet with friends for a happy hour drink. No DJ just an IPOD. There is also great local art work inside. Laddies the bathrooms are really clean

Big ups to Joel and his lady on a great bar
author: Robert M.

description:
My favs on Sunday 
Great bloody marys with home made mix
Everyone who works there is super nice, down to earth, neighborhood folk.
author: Ashley P.

description: I went to a small art show here. This is a solid little bar -- a little trendy/a little edgy.  It's dark and cutely appointed - gets very packed. The bartender IDed me and none of my other friends b/c he said I looked older, so I had to dock them a point. Don't know what else to say.
author: Andrew K.

description: This was the only full bar we could find while waiting for a table at NOPA, and it's not that great.  It doesn't seem as "dive"-y as aforementioned reviews would have you think it is.  The place is small & clean with nice photography on the walls.  I ordered a lemon drop with no sugar on the rim and got bottom shelf vodka with lime juice & no sugar in it (talk about puckering up...) but it still had the sticky mess of a sugar rim I was trying to avoid in the first place.  At least it was only $6.  All in all, "meh" sums it up.
author: Sally L.

description:
Awesome new bar with great staff and an excellent selection of potables and art. They also are fairly green in their practices, which is a feat for bars (speak to Elixir & Doc's on that!)
I really love the deep red walls in the back area of the bar, sultry!
author: Colleen B.

description:
Update:  They are now open and serve much more than just beer/wine, which is great news.  The people working seem really nice, but I'll plan to go a few more times before I give it a proper review.  And hey, I haven't had a chance to have one of their Bloody Mary's. =)

Old Review:
Well, I know it's hard to give 5-stars to a place that isn't open yet - but I have high hopes!!  

While 831 Divis is really close to my house, I hate that it closes early and refuse to go because of this reason alone.   If this new bar stays open till 2am, I'll be really happy.  Although I think I have heard it's another beer/wine place, which will kinda suck. 

I'll make sure to update my review when they are finally open.
author: Josh M.

description: My friends and I were in the mood for some festive drinks and asked the bartender if he had any coconut rum. Are we cheesy? Yes. Do we know it? Yes. He told us they didn't stock coconut rum because they were "classier" than that. I told him the Polo Lounge in the Beverly Hills Hotel stocked it and they were pretty classy, but he didn't like that. We decided on some Mai Tai's and he made sure to announce it nice and loud when they were ready so everyone at the bar could have a good laugh. Now THAT was classy. But hey, Mini Bartender, it looks like you won in the end. You made me pay for 3 shitty Mai Tai's and I only get to write a 1 Star Review of your business and give you no more money. Well played.
author: Vince D.

description: Best SF Bloody Mary I have ever had, indubitably. Thanks Sunday James!
author: Jen S.

description: Is it wrong to judge a bar for being small when it's in the name? Probably. Bartenders were nice, prices were inexpensive. I think there were a couple of bday parties when we went, as there was no room for our group of 7 to congregate. Back room looked awesome and I'll definitely be going back.
author: Lauren J.

description:
Like usual, I am late to the punch. Really, what does one have to do to be the first to review something?  I guess I need to wonder around the city, notice places about to open and then write my review on some portable device while there.  Chill the fuck out people. 

Anyhow, I digress, and if you can't tell, I have been a bit stressed lately. Hence my recent stop at Mini Bar.  Mini bar is not much in the way of bars, it has your traditional drinks and general choices. However, the real allure here is the art.  Mini bar is not trying to be something other than what it is. Typical drinks in a cool place with interesting art.  Its like mac and cheese. Not nobel prize winning, but still good. Oh ya, try the keg house wine, its actually not bad.  I was suprised and pleasently so. 

Everything all together, I am dedcuting stars because the owner was shit talking the Love Parade. Hey, now!!! Stop that. I help produce the Lovefest.  Actually, it was quite amicable, but if you go, give her shit and request electonic music. She's a punk rock chick and thats sure to get you into a good conversation!
author: david c.

description:
100% pure awesome.  

Great booze.  Great bartenders.  Great space.  Great art.  

SF needs more classy-ass, yet low-key places like this one!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
In the 'hood. - yay
Minimal seating - nay
Normal peeps including a sprinkling of hipsters, burningman folks and just plain ol' neighborhood alchies (moi) - yay
Full bar - yay
Semi-slow service - nay *may speed up w/ more practice and time

Not my favorite yet...would rather go to The Page, but good addition to the local bar scene!
author: Deann M.

description:
2 things I love about you:
1. That keg of Mas wine, and 
2. The little back room. 

Gets a little busy on weekends but the bar tenders are cool and it has a nice vibe.
author: Hilary P.

description:
Ended up here again last night (i live like 1/2 a block away). I used to really like this bar. To start, the bar tender was a total B!@# last night. She was rude and slow. Reading over the other reviews, it seems like they have a consistent problem with shotty and or rude service. The drinks are very much over priced, $6 for a house wine, which wouldnt be so bad if they wheren't so extremely skimpy on the pours. Ive had heavier pours at wine tastings. This was shitty wine, get over yourselves.... Next they charged my girlfriend $3 for a water. Maybe that lemon was really expensive...

In summary, there's a plethora of bars on Divisadero that are bigger, cheaper, and have amazing service. Dont waste your time on this place...
author: J Z.

description:
Great ambiance, friendly staff, interesting art and a new signature drink thanks to moi. (Drew - call the drink "Briya".

I will be back even though I don't live in SF anymore.

B
author: Briya S.

description:
I have a soft spot for this place. 

Maybe because Molly (a bartender) is so nice to us, maybe because it's one of my neighborhood bars or because they let me order in Little Star from across the street when I drink my Margarita.

Sometimes it's too mini for me when I can't get a seat, but that's part of the fun when you're the one with the table!
author: Sarah G.

description:
Soooo....I was driving by one night and almost crashed trying to do a triple-take on what new bar had popped up on Divisadero next to Bar 821! I pulled a u-turn and had to run in!

It's very cute, cozy, intimate and plain cool. This place has been open for 2 weeks the owner tells me-I sat at the bar and the bartender made me an awesome raspberry lemondrop-one of my favorite cocktails. THe atmosphere here is very friendly-I didn't dive too much into the signature cocktails, but the drink I had was perfect enough. Bathrooms are CLEAN 
(Whooo-hooo!!)

The art on the wall is cool and I love the lil "champagne" room in the back ha! I would definitely come back here-I always appreciate new spots-never a dull day in SF ;)
author: Dessa R.

description: Our neighborhood bar! !  Love the Mini Bar :) Always pretty mellow, not a lot of douchebaggery going on, nice bartenders,  just a great place to get a drink.
author: Akemi O.

description:
Five stars for my first time here on a Wednesday night.

My friend and I sat ourselves at the bar.  Very small bar but full liquor license!  Friendly and very knowledgeable bartender who really schooled me on Scotch.

Not sure how it is on the weekends...  Sardine-style packed bars are not my fave, and this one would fill up fast.  But I will definitely be back for a mid week night cap!

Oh, and good artwork on the walls.  Big bonus.
author: ella j.

description: Awesomeness, from the art to the bartenders (hi Molly!) to the drunken dudes rambling on about the Amish and how kids today don't know how to fuck shit up (wait, was that me?).
author: Dan S.

description: Cool bar :) I like it - great vibe & decorations. Definitely go to the back room - totally awesome. Frequent this place every Tuesday :) No food, so be sure to hop across the street and get pizza from Little Star! :)
author: linda t.

description: Mini Bar SF....eh. This bar has great drinks and fun art to "critique" as you get your drink on but it is long, narrow, and typically packed. If you can get your hands on a ledge then it makes the experience all that much better. Otherwise... channel your inner art student, throw an elbow, and settle in for a beer. Per usual on Divis.. .bring cash.
author: Jessica P.

description:
I attended the "soft" opening and was very impressed.

I live in the neighborhood and met the owners. They are very committed to making this place welcoming to the neighborhood and supportive of emerging artists. 

It's impressive what the owners have done with a narrow space - cool art, beautiful bar, a couple of lovely custom-designed booth seats, semi-private back room, attractive interior painting and lighting.

SOMMER is AWESOME.
author: Dan N.

description:
This place is great! we went there on a thursday night when they were doing an art show (i guess they do a new art installation approx every 6 weeks). apparently, whenever they do a new art show they have happy hour prices all night along with complimentary cheeses and chicken from the bbq place next door! what a deal! 

also, the drinks are stiff and the service was friendly and prompt. it's a small place, but not in a bad way. there is a big(ish) back room with couches and chairs for extra seating.
author: Joanna F.

description: Small hidden treasure.
author: HY L.

description: Who designed this place? There is no safe spot in this bar where someone will not bump into you. I constantly hear "excuse me" because the genius architect behind Mini Bar decides to give the lone bartender 500 square feet of legroom and none to their clientele. Sure there's art on the wall, but this is a BAR! It takes me 15 minutes every time to get my beer and the single bathroom is tucked away in the most inconvenient spot of the room. No thanks.
author: Joe G.

description: Absolutely fantastic. Really nice bartenders. Attentive, professional, and friendly. They don't know much, but they try hard, and that was good enough. Nice atmosphere. Not too loud. Nice art. Nice music. Nice light. Small. Nice people. Good drink selection.
author: Eater S.

description: I'd usually go 4 stars here because the space is nice and the drinks are wonderful, but as the only bar on Divis that offers a full bar, this place gets jam-packed on most summer nights.  The trick is come early (6-8) to avoid the crowds.   Especially true if you're bringing your dog, which is allowed.
author: John H.

description: This mini bar is larger, plusher, cheaper and stocked with more premium liquor than any mini bar I have encountered..... and it comes complete with one of the nicest bartenders ever. Holiday Inn room 403 has nothing on this place.
author: Drue C.

description:
this is my new favorite (and local) bar.

every tiny detail in, about and around this place is well thought out and cool as fuck.

unfortunately, they are only open until 11pm these days and until that time gets pushed back, i won't be able to enjoy the mininess since i can only come out and play after midnight at present...

look, to whoever just 'funnied' this review, i am well aware that this review isn't even remotely funny, but thank you anyway.  i just don't have that kind of time these days to make shit funny anymore.  sorry.  maybe in  a few months when things get better i can get back to being funny and shit.  i dunno.  for now i suck, so leave me alone.
author: Karen K.

description: I've been here a few times and its a great little bar. They support local artists who hang thier photos, paintings, drawings, etc on the walls, and have a good exchange of each over the months. Polly, one of the owners is super cool, and they keep drink prices down. Beers are $4 at all times, Wines around $5-8, and sparkling $6-8, and they have a full bar. I haven't been for happy hour, but am sure its lower. It'll hold about 40 people with about 15 seats at the bar and 2 booths plus standing room. There is also a slightly private room near the back that will hold around 10 people seated. Cool Spot.
author: Adam X.

description:
its a great bar when its not packed wall to friggen wall. when it gets that crowded leave. if you stay in this place when you cant even move it because you have an overwhelming need to belong and feel like your a part of something. 
OK that's my attempt to clear it during its busiest times. 
oh and get some good Bourbon, no Knob Creek, Woodford?
author: michelle m.

description: I go out here every once and a while. As a local its a good place to hide out from the crowds on Divisdero. Good drinks, small place, cool little room in the back. If your swift like me you can grab some seats on the couches and it's really nice.
author: Amber I.

description: What a great space! Nice art on the wall, great beers on tap, smart music and just a cool vibe, this is going to be one of my favorite spots for drinks!
author: Chris D.

description: The staff have excellent service and are well schooled in their craft.  It's cozy and easy to chat with new and unsuspecting strangers.  Not a lot of sitting as it's more of an alley type layout.  It's nice for small groups to mingle and lovely for a ladies night.  Thumbs up good option for a low key night.
author: Velvet V.

description: If this bar were in my neighborhood I would be in there way too much.  Really cute space, and the drinks were amazing as well.  I had the spicy bloody Mary, and I loved the fresh cucumber in the tomato juice.  It was like gazpacho with spicy vodka, yum!  My friend and I went on Halloween night, so it wasn't very busy, don't know how it is on a normal night.  Love the rotating art!
author: Sarah M.

description:
Probably not the most fair review grounds, but this lowly one star is meant to be strictly negative to the JERK bouncer working on Thursday Sept. 4th who was a total dick to my friends and I as we were trying to come in. Shaved short hair, tan skin...yeah YOU, guy. Not even a busy night either and you had to push everything and just flex your power. 

Think about the clientele who comes to this place vs. the rest of the neighborhood. Hipster, young, slightly caucasian possibly, riding stupid fixies...not the THUGGERY in the 'hood that surrounds it. So, don't pretend to be too much of a thug yourself and front on us "make love not gang fights" types. We don't need it. 

If you can get PAST the door to have a good experience here, I think it's possible. Seems like a nice joint and I want to give it a shot. But this is my review for now.
author: Eric D.

description: I kind of like this place! When Girl's Night found us here I wasn't upset. We all grabbed our respective beverages and they didn't cost us much either. Comfortable seating and some cute little areas that make it easy to hear conversation are easily found. The bathroom is super cute and very clean and I never had to wait in line the 3 times I used it. I'd go back and if I lived in this 'hood I'd be a regular for sure!
author: Jill D.

description: This place is cool.   Mini bar isnt just a name the bar is actually pretty small but it has pleanty of atmosphere.  I like this place because it is just down the street and it is a full bar and unlike other full bars in the area it is nice not all run down and ghetto  you can go there with your girlfriend one night and your buddies the next.
author: Jeff H.

description: Great drinks and some pretty damn good whiskey. Apparently they also have all sorts of gimlets, but I haven't tried 'em.
author: Roman N.

description: Only had the one experience here, but damn I wanna live in San Francisco. Racer 5 for $4, Anchor Steam is cheap and bountiful. The bar was comfy, despite being "mini." The back room was better though, nice couches, felt like I was hanging with friends in a chill hipster pad. Friendly as hell bartenders, but I guess that is how you peeps roll up there. Mad respecting happening.
author: Nathan W.

description: What I like about Mini Bar is that it is a shining example of the great comeback of the Western Addition. D Street is one of the coolest spots in the City and Mini Bar leads the way with its lively "locals" feeling, no bullshit approach and fantastic curation of weird art. I enjoyed the exhibition of NoisePop posters a couple months back. This bar really rounds out the lower Divis. area.
author: Andrew K.

description: Cute, small, immaculately clean bar w/ nice bouncer and wholesome singles and couples mostly 20s, early 30s.
author: Melanie C.

description: I love a bar that serves hoppy beers, end of story.
author: casey c.

description: I came on the second night and was greeted by a nice doorman. I live a block away and couldn't wait to try this place finally!  CONGRATS for getting it open and running.  The space was warm and clean and I liked the art.  We made up our own names for the art, which is always fun with modern art.  Like "Melting Igloo" or "Sideways Pointy Horse" etc. The back space was also interesting, but perhaps the lighting could be different?  I also would have like the music to be a tad louder, as someone mentioned.  The only complaint I really have is that one of the bartenders seemed really green. We went to party later at Casanova in the Mission and the drinks were much stronger and more artfully prepared.I'll be back in.
author: Aaron W.

description:
I have only been once.  The 2nd night they were open.  Pretty full, but was able to get a seat at the bar.  I was with 3 girls and we were excited to have a full bar in the hood.  My house actually backs up to Mini Bar on Broderick.  

Was very put off by the owner who kindly indroduced himself, served me a Kettle and soda for $6.  VERY COOL.  Then the 2nd drink was $7. OK.... The third he said $8, but he took $9 out of my 20.  Haven't been back.  That alone just ruined what would have been a great relationship.
author: Tyke J.

description: Well it's around the corner from my house so of course I love this new tiny lounge and art gallery in Western Addition (otherwise known as Popeye's Terrace or, ok, NOPA.) While it's upscale it's certainly not pretentious and goes by one ideal I support - localism. Artists in the Mcallister/Divis area are encouraged to bring their work to the Mini Bar where exhibits will changes every few weeks. Beware- it's not just a clever name.
author: Jessica M.

description:
The place to go when you're waiting for a table at Little Star.  It's literally across the street.  Put your name in and then head across Divis for a beer or cocktail.

Pros - good beer selection, reasonable prices and comfy booths.  Cranky bouncers, sometimes cranky bartenders, and slow service are the cons.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Jesus, time to call the hater Wahhhhmbulance.  "You are a bar and have a doorman"  WAHHHH.  "Drinks cost more than $3"  WAHHHHH.  "There is art on the walls"  WAHHHHH.  Get over yourselves.  Its a nice neighborhood bar, if you don't like it you can always waste your life in the same cheap crappy watering hole you have been for the previous years of your sorry whiny life.
author: Excitable R.

description: Cool space, laid-back atmosphere. Another great spot for the Divis corridor that seems to spit out these great bars like a factory. Came here with a few friends on a Friday night while waiting for a table at Little Star, and definitely glad we did. Didn't order from the cocktail list, but from what I could tell, they make some tasty ones. Small but good beer from the tap list, and a decent wine list as well. I could see it being a great spot to catch up with friends, like I was doing, or taking a date here after Nopa or Tsunami. It definitely would have been on my short list back in the day when I was courting my wife in the neighborhood.
author: Chris B.

description: Dan TNT and I walk in late Christmas Eve. Patrons are loud and happy.  Molly the bartender is cucumber cool - her pouring and mixing are effortless despite the demanding crowd.  She gives us some cookies she made. We wait for Sunny.  Sunny comes. Then it's midnight.  We have to leave. Something about the law.
author: Keith K.

description: They stole my perfect idea of a place with awesome bartenders, nice seating areas, outstanding selections, champagne cocktails, incredible happy hour deals, vibrance, cozy, relaxing, fun...yes I give myself 5 stars!
author: Daniella B.

description: The sign says "modern art & classic cocktails," how could I *not* check this place out? Inside, Mini Bar is funky and intimate, a perfect place to (re)charge your batteries. After our group dinner at nearby Blue Jay Cafe, a few of us stopped in to fuel up before the serious partying that lay ahead. Racer 5's for me and my friend, Jack & Coke for the others, a nice little back lounge to kick back, interesting art, and friendly staff; we couldn't have asked for anything more.
author: Daniel D.

description: I recently went there with a bunch of friends on a pub crawl for my birthday & we had an awesome time.  Great music, chill atmosphere, great drinks/prices & friendly bartenders.  Love that I live so close & it's across the street from Little Star (best pizza in the city).  Now, if we could just get some decent shopping on Divis.....
author: Jamie R.

description: I love mini bar! The drinks are perfect and all of the staff is so friendly! I especially love the cozy lounge in the back. LOVE IT!
author: Desiree P.

description: The initial suggestion of coming to Mini Bar didnt overwhelm me with excitement.  I mean, a mini bar in itself is a small fridge packed with small drinks...and any true alcoholic can sympathize paying for small drinks.  But my fears were put to an end quite abruptly after reaching the bar.  The shots were normal, but I think it's the atmosphere and wonderland of local art that truly makes this place a winner.
author: Brent N.

description: Rounded up a group and hit Mini Bar on Saturday night to celebrate my birthday.  What a great place!  We filled the back room and the bar staff were really lovely all night.  The art on the walls is great and the bar had a relaxed fun vibe all night long.  I'll go back for a more low-key visit again soon.
author: Nick S.

description: The place is narrow and doesn't have enough seating, but they have a hard to find whiskey: St. George. It's fine, fragrant & delicious ... perfect for when I'm feeling like a lady!
author: Sumi Y.

description: I've been here twice, both times on a Sunday evening. The first time, I kept falling asleep (probably because of the half marathon I ran that morning). They had really comfy couches in the front of the bar and the backroom of the bar. The second time, I was awake. The drinks are stiff and the bloody mary's are supposed to be great. I'll have to come back for a bloody. Great atmosphere and cool bartenders. I also like a bar that has coat-hooks under the bar top.
author: Kevin Q.

description: love this place. it has all the potential to be  tool shed of bars but its not. the crowd and vibe is cool i dig the art and they serve me booze. what more could i want.
author: Mattew W.

description: On my second visit I noticed a few things that detracted from the experience here.  My Hendrick's and tonic was $8 and very weak, it's way too bright in here, it was really hot, and they were out of Damnation.  Still not a horrible place for a drink in the neighborhood, but I think it's still worth walking the 5 or 6 blocks south to the Page.
author: Joshua W.

description: Cool little bar. Went last night before a show at the Independent. Friendly bartender, plenty of open seats, good beer selection, cheap drinks - really what more do you want from a neighborhood bar? Beers are $4 each and at happy hour only $3. Nice! Worth stopping by if you're looking for a watering hole in the area.
author: Sarah R.

description: I always hit this place up on my "happy hour run" after a long week of work.  This is a very positive, hip addition to the otherwise not-so-hip or positive Wester Addition.  First of all, I have met some of the owners and they are invested in revitalising the WA (and Divis. specifically) with things such as the "Art Walk" that occurs every month I believe.  Very cool.  Secondly, the bartenders here are friendly and helpful (as opposed to say the 500 club).  Third, the interior is artsy (local artists can hang pieces on the walls-like Gerrard L. did a few months back) and sophisticated.  Only bad thing about this place is that they don't carry red bull.  This drink is not solely consumed by tweeniboppers.
author: Brandon C.

description: Mini Bar is fine.  Nothing special.  Not sure what the fuss is about.  Small intimate space, maybe in another hood this wouldn't rate a second glance.  Drinks are not cheap and not special.  The Alembic this isn't.
author: Aaron T.

description: apparently, i really like this place. i seem to take everyone here...they make tasty drinks at relatively affordable prices and the space is nice and intimate. i just noticed the rear "living room" space this past weekend and will have to go back to sit on one of those comfy looking leather couches. my only reservations are that it is only open until 2am on fridays and saturdays (what the hell?) and that once when i came here on a wednesday they had the lights up and no music which i thought was kind of awkward...i'll still be back.
author: Rachael S.

description: Very Small, but delightfully decorated. Service good, prices great! and a neighborhood bar all in one. Once inside you forget your on Divisadero with the loud Muni going by every 20 minutes. Across the Street from Little Star Pizza which I love too!. Drop in for a few you will be back!
author: Susie S.

description: Love staying local so this is a great addition to our neighborhood. It's fresh, clean and has good music taste. With only one bar tender tho double up on your drinks.
author: sarah l.

description: i don't do bars in my hood, but stopped in early saturday night and the bartender named drew was cool.  it was early in the evening but it's probably the best bar on divisadero street.
author: Pickle R.

description: This place is AMAZING.  The spicy bloodies are delicious and the fact that they serve magnolia beer makes me so happy.  The owners are also top notch!  I was also pleased with the amount of artwork on the walls.  I will be frequenting this place too much for my own good (or my liver's). . . but so be it!  I have been there quite a few times, most memorably for my birthday bash.  The bartenders were AWESOME and it was a blast to have such an awesome space filled with my nearest and dearest getting (mildly) sauced on a sunday.  This is hands down one of my favorite bars especially  during the daytime when I can get a seat!
author: Michelle M.

description: i love wes p's review - i had a similar bartender experience here when I ordered a campari/soda; the guy smacked it down on the counter and said "how's that for an orange slice?" and he was right - it was a thick, generous, delicious piece, which both was great for the drink and a testament to these guys' awesomeness.
author: James R.

description: Well after a year of Mini Bar awaiting their green light to open, I am glad to see these folks up and running.  As a local in the neighborhood I know i am def. happy to see a full bar open up because one can only drink so much sake and soju cocktails- which have taken over everywhere due to SF's next to impossible liquor license acquisition.  I dont know who they had to knock off to get this license but whoever they were, I hope they are smiling in their grave knowing that the NOPA-lites are getting sauced and loving it.  R.I.P. soju.  I will say that when I stopped in on opening night, I didn't order a drink so I cant review that.  Also, it was not the neighborhood crowd which is fine and to be expected since it was an opening.  What I did pay more attention to was the art, which is decent but because of this aspect the lighting in MIni-Bar is way too bright.  They are lighting the art well but its not cozy nor relaxing.  Its like being in a gallery.  They have this cool lounge room (with what I think were leather sofas) in the back up a few stairs but when I went back to it I felt like I needed sunglasses if I were to ever hang back there.  If they dimmed the lights--that room will become prime make-out  real estate.--. Lighting for art's sake I understand, but at the end of the day this is a bar and should feel like one.  Minus one star for that.  And I agree with another reviewer who says that music is key and should be a main focal point.  I can't recall if and/or what they had playing but I do hope they incorporate good DJ's or mixes or both.  I spoke with one of the owners, Summer who was very sweet and welcoming and she mentioned they had been paying rent since last August!  Thats reason enough to get me in there for some drinks...these people need our support!  As if they haven't dealt with enough delays, she mentioned that  apparently there are 2 individuals in the neighborhood who arent so thrilled on a new bar so they have been making this long overdue opening not only annoying to the owners but us locals too and as a result  Mini Bar is required to close at midnight until further notice (upcoming public hearing: date unknown).  These folks protesting dont live above the bar or even on the same block so thats gotta suck for Mini.  This is Divisadero St. for crying out loud!!  So with a few hurdles still left to clear, by all intents and purposes --Mini Bar is open, looking good (minus the bright lighting), and serving up good cocktails.  They are also doing Bloody Mary's , etc. on the weekends starting around noon so that will be another plus for them.  Buena Suerte Mini-Bar---We got yer back but turn down those lights a bit!
author: Julie S.

description: this place is so small the mice are hunch back. seriously, its so small i had to go outside to change my mind. really, cool "little" bar. it even has that new bar smell.
author: Jeff B.
